summary: Prince Edward Island (PEI), the smallest Canadian province, is known for its dense population and nicknames like "Garden of the Gulf." Originally inhabited by the Mi'kmaq, it was colonized by the French in 1604. After changing hands between France and Britain, it became a separate British colony in 1798. PEI played a key role in Canada's formation, hosting the Charlottetown Conference in 1864. It joined Canada in 1873. Today, about 177,000 people live on the island, which is famous for potato farming and tourism. It's located in the Gulf of St. Lawrence, near Nova Scotia and New Brunswick.
title: Prince Edward Island
